channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Belgium rejects EU plan to use frozen Russian assets for Ukraine
item.description: Belgium on Wednesday rejected a plan to use frozen Russian assets to help prop up Ukraine's economy and war effort over the next two years, saying tha...

item.title: 50 years after the birth of special education, some fear for its future under Trump
item.description: The Trump administration has fired, or tried to fire, many of the federal staff who manage and enforce federal disability law in schools.

item.title: The use and misuse of the word 'ideology'
item.description: The word "ideology" has become a fixture in American political rhetoric, invoked by leaders to cast opponents' beliefs as dangerous, stupid or unfound...

item.title: A Palestinian convicted in bombing plot is now an award-winning novelist, and free
item.description: Bassem Khandaqji entered prison 21 years ago for plotting a deadly bombing in Israel. He left prison as an award-winning novelist.

item.title: Democrats seek limits on who can serve as immigration judges amid mass layoffs
item.description: The legislation comes after the White House authorized up to 600 military lawyers to be temporary immigration judges and scrapped requirements for the...

item.title: 12/2: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth doubles down on strikes on alleged drug boats, saying they have "only just begun;" New book exposes China's state-run e...

item.title: Steve Rosenberg: Putin showing no signs of compromise
item.description: The BBC's Russia Editor shares his analysis after five hours of peace talks between the Russians and the US.

item.title: Trump targets Minnesota’s Somali community with harsh words and policies
India revokes order for phone makers to install security app amid uproar
item.description: India's government, amid an uproar over privacy, has revoked an order quietly issued to smartphone makers to pre-install a state-run security app.

item.title: Trump says he does not want Somalis in US as ICE plans Minnesota operation
item.description: The president says the US will "go the wrong way if we keep taking in garbage into our country".

item.title: 10/29: CBS Morning News
item.description: Hurricane Melissa moves into Cuba as Jamaica surveys catastrophic damage; Microsoft and OpenAI announce a restructuring deal.

item.title: Duckworth demands DOT give $10K bonus to all air traffic controllers, FAA techs
item.description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said that the bonus would be given only to controllers and technicians who didn't miss a shift during the shutdown...

item.title: Australia is banning social media for kids under 16. How will it work?
item.description: The world-first law aims to reduce the risks children face online, but critics fear it may not work.

item.title: India scraps order to pre-install state-run cyber safety app on smartphones
item.description: The order to make the registration mandatory had led to a major backlash from several cyber experts.

item.title: Man accused of swallowing $19,000 pendant inspired by Bond movie
item.description: The alleged loot was a limited-edition, Fabergé egg pendant inspired by the 1983 James Bond film Octopussy.

item.title: Was it a coup or was it a 'sham'? Behind Guinea-Bissau's military takeover
item.description: The military has taken over but some say the overthrow of the president was not what it seemed.

item.title: Trump-backed Republican Matt Van Epps wins US House special election in Tennessee
Federal authorities plan operation in Minnesota focusing on Somali immigrants, AP source says
item.description: Federal authorities are preparing an immigration enforcement operation in Minnesota, focusing on Somali immigrants living unlawfully in the U.S.
